body:
Output of `helm version`:
`version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-alpha.1", GitCommit:"b9a54967f838723fe241172a6b94d18caf8bcdca", GitTreeState:"clean"}`

Output of `kubectl version`:
`Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1", GitCommit:"b7394102d6ef778017f2ca4046abbaa23b88c290", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-08T17:11:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"windows/amd64"}`

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
Azure Container Registry (but should be reproducable on any OCI compatible registry)

Repro:
- `helm create test`
- `helm chart save test myreg.azurecr.io/test` (replace registry url)
- `helm chart push myreg.azurecr.io/test`

Output `helm chart push` command:
```
Using default tag: latest
The push refers to repository [myreg.azurecr.io/test]
Name: test
Version: 0.1.0
Meta: sha256:xxx
Content: sha256:xxx
latest: pushed to remote (2 layers, 2.3 KiB total)
```

Expected: 
The output indicates the the default tag (`latest`) is used, so it's expected that the remote registry now contains a `test` repository with a manifest tagged `latest`.

Actual:
The remote registry now contains a `test` repository with a single manifest, but its untagged (or at least not tagged latest).

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: bug

labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3
labels.name: v3.x

title: Helm 3-alpha1: pushing chart without tag specified results in untagged chart instead of latest
